com.nitnelave.xmlparser

Annotation Type XMLProperty


  • @Documented
@Retention(value=RUNTIME)
@Target(value=TYPE)
public @interface XMLProperty
    Annotation to describe a single XML node property.

    This annotation describes a property of the XML tag. It must be encapsulated in an XMLProperties to allow for several properties.

    The values of properties (see valueType()) must implement a constructor that takes a String. It will be called with the value of the property. If an exception is thrown during the construction of the value, the method will be called with null as parameter.

    For example, the tag
    <Person name="John" age="18" />
    could be described by the annotation: 

         @XMLNode
     @XMLProperties({@XMLProperty(name = "Age", key = "age", valueType = Integer.class),
                     @XMLProperty(name = "Name", key = "name", valueType = String.class, required = true)})
     public class Person { ... }
    This means that Person is a root node (see XMLNode), and has 2 properties:
    • Age, referenced by the xml key "age", that is an integer. Because of the name, the method called to register the property will be setAge(Integer age).
    • Name, referenced by the xml key "name", a String. This property is required, and an exception will be raised if it is absent.

    Author:
    nitnelave
    See Also:
    XMLNode, XMLProperties

    • Required Element Summary

      Required Elements 
      Modifier and Type Required Element and Description
      java.lang.String key
      The key to find the property in the XML.
      java.lang.String name
      The name of the property.
      java.lang.Class<?> valueType
      The type of the data associated with the property.

    • Optional Element Summary

      Optional Elements 
      Modifier and Type Optional Element and Description
      boolean required
      Property required flag.

    • Element Detail

      • key

        public abstract java.lang.String key
        The key to find the property in the XML. If the tag to parse is
        <Node max_age="3" />
        the key would be "max_age".
        Returns:
        The property key.

      • name

        public abstract java.lang.String name
        The name of the property. Corresponds to the setter signature, i.e. if the name is "MaxAge" (note the CameCase), the expected setter is 
        public void setMaxAge(Integer age)
        Returns:
        The property name.

      • valueType

        public abstract java.lang.Class<?> valueType
        The type of the data associated with the property. The class must define a constructor with a String as only argument.
        Returns:
        The data class.

      • required

        public abstract boolean required
        Property required flag. If true, then a node missing this property will raise an exception.
        Returns:
        Whether this property is required.
        Default:
        false
